line_1: And sings their constant Loves, and constant Hates;
line_2: Their diff'ring Forms and Ways of Life relates;

line_1: The coming Ship, but him the Sailor hates.
line_2: Far from the Shore the wily Sucker waits

line_1: So way ward Beauty its own Offspring hates,
line_2: And kills the Passion, which it self creates.

line_1: Force Thee to suffer what thy Honor hates:
line_2: O Grief of Heart! that our unhappy Fates

line_1: And ev'ry fool puffs off the fool he hates:
line_2: At least appearance of good will creates;

line_1: And constant Sympathies, and constant Hates;
line_2: Have each their several Laws, and settled States,
